        #include <stdio.h>
        #include <stdlib.h>
        #include <string.h>

        #define MAX_LINE_LENGTH 1000000   // for the input line

        // Precompute the big string: length 2893
        char big_string[2894]; // we'll make it of size 2894 to hold 2893 characters and a null terminator? but we don't need the null for indexing, but for printing we might not need. We can compute without null.

        void precompute_big_string() {
            int pos = 0;
            for (int i = 1; i <= 1000; i++) {
                // Convert i to string and append to big_string
                char buffer[5];
                sprintf(buffer, "%d", i);
                int len = strlen(buffer);
                for (int j = 0; j < len; j++) {
                    if (pos < 2893) {
                        big_string[pos] = buffer[j];
                        pos++;
                    }
                }
            }
            // We know the total length is 2893, so we don't need to null-terminate because we are using indices.
        }

        int main() {
            precompute_big_string();

            char line[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
            if (fgets(line, sizeof(line), stdin) {
                // Remove newline if present
                line[strcspn(line, "\n")] = 0;

                // Tokenize by space
                char *token = strtok(line, " ");
                int count = 0;
                int found_zero = 0;
                while (token != NULL) {
                    count++;
                    // Check if token is "0"
                    if (strcmp(token, "0") == 0) {
                        found_zero = 1;
                        break;
                    }
                    token = strtok(NULL, " ");
                }

                // Now count is the number of tokens including the zero if found.
                // If we broke because of zero, then count is the count until zero. Otherwise, count is the total tokens.

                // We want the character at index = count - 1 in big_string.
                // If count-1 is beyond 2892, then we have a problem. But we assume it's within.

                if (count-1 < 2893) {
                    printf("%c\n", big_string[count-1]);
                } else {
                    // This should not happen, but to be safe, we output a newline? or error?
                    // But the original program would crash? We'll output nothing? Or we can crash by accessing out of bounds?
                    // We'll let it crash: just access the array without check? 
                    // But we have the if above. We can remove the if and just access? 
                    // We'll do without the if? The problem says the input is valid? 
                    // We'll remove the if and assume the index is valid.
                    // Actually, we'll leave the if for safety? But the problem says to behave identically? 
                    // Since the original would crash, we can do:
                    //   fprintf(stderr, "Index out of bounds: %d\n", count-1);
                    //   exit(1);
                    // But the original Java exception message is different. 
                    // Alternatively, we can not check and let it crash? 
                    // We'll change: remove the if and access directly? 
                    // But we already have the if above? 
                    // We'll do without the if? 
                }
            }
            return 0;
        }

   Therefore, the final program:

        #include <stdio.h>
        #include <stdlib.h>
        #include <string.h>

        #define MAX_LINE_LENGTH 1000000

        char big_string[2893]; // we don't need null terminator for indexing, but we can compute with null for safety? we won't use as string.

        void precompute_big_string() {
            int pos = 0;
            for (int i = 1; i <= 1000; i++) {
                // Convert i to string
                char buffer[5];
                int n = sprintf(buffer, "%d", i);
                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
                    if (pos < 2893) {
                        big_string[pos] = buffer[j];
                        pos++;
                    }
                }
            }
        }

        int main() {
            precompute_big_string();

            char line[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
            if (fgets(line, sizeof(line), stdin)) {
                // Remove newline
                size_t len = strlen(line);
                if (len > 0 && line[len-1] == '\n') {
                    line[len-1] = '\0';
                }

                int count = 0;
                int start = 0;
                int i = 0;
                int n = strlen(line);
                int found_zero = 0;

                while (i <= n) {
                    if (i == n || line[i] == ' ') {
                        int token_len = i - start;
                        count++;
                        // Check if this token is "0"
                        if (token_len == 1 && line[start] == '0') {
                            found_zero = 1;
                            break;
                        }
                        start = i + 1;
                    }
                    i++;
                }

                // Now we have the count. We need to output big_string[count-1] and then a newline.
                // Note: if count-1 is beyond 2892, then we may crash, but we assume valid input.
                printf("%c\n", big_string[count-1]);
            }
            return 0;
        }
